title: XO Tour Llif3
description: “XO Tour Llif3” is a chronicle of Uzi’s relationship issues with ex-girlfriend, Brittany Byrd, and substance abuse. LUV premiered the track in London while opening for The Weeknd ’s Starboy: Legend of the Fall 2017 world tour. P2 is the outro to Eternal Atake, excluding two bonus tracks.

annotations_with_timestamps.annotation: Uzi has a new song called, “Go Off,” featured in the film, The Fate of The Furious. C-note is a slang term for an American $100 bill. A “G-roll” refers to a wad of cash mostly formed of smaller bills. The producer of the song, TM88, the producer of this song, explained the production behind this song.

Uzi raps about his friends that were killed in his hometown of north Philly in songs like “YSL” and “LUV SCARS K.o 1600” He hinted on his song “444+222” that his net worth was $4 million. The producer of the track, TM88, confirmed that “All my friends are dead,” is referring to dead presidents, which is slang for money.

Lil Uzi has expressed on Twitter that the universe is a figment of his imagination and he considers himself “not from this Earth” He has also tweeted an image referencing solipsism, or the belief that only one’s own mind is sure to exist. This may call back to one of Uzi's older songs “Ps & Qs,” which was featured on his mixtape, where he talks about stealing his former girlfriend Brittany Byrd from another guy.

Throwing ones (one dollar bills) is a common act performed in a strip club by many people. Uzi talks about his past, explaining how he didn't have ones to throw in the clubs and would beg strippers to perform acts. Another artist close to Uzi, NAV, also talks about throwing ones on his song “NAVUZIMETRO#PT2” which coincidentally features Uzi.

Lil' Uzi and Brittany Byrd broke up in June of 2016, so it is assumed that this song is describing the end of their relationship. Uzi said in a 2016 interview that he’s trying to stop using Xanax or Xanny. In November 2017, rapper Lil Peep died of a Xanax-related drug overdose, which prompted Uzi to re-iterate that he was trying to kick his habit.
